talk1052:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_00>Thanks to your efforts, the sludge has
disappeared, meaning that I can resume
my research. Needless to say...
I cannot possibly thank you enough!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive>Ahem...<sp:5:1:0> Speaking of thanks, Queen Yona
mentioned that she would like to gift you
a token of gratitude.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>It is no business of mine,<sp:5:0:0> but I do
encourage you to hear what she
has to say.

talk1045:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_00>Ah, Link! It is good to see you. I am,
after all, indebted to you for your
repair of the stone slate.
Thanks to your efforts, the sludge has
disappeared, meaning that I can resume
my research. Needless to say...
<snd:LaughS_00>I cannot possibly thank you enough!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:TalkPositive_01>Ahem...<sp:5:1:0> Speaking of thanks, Queen Yona

talk1054:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_00>Thanks to your efforts, the sludge has
disappeared, meaning that I can resume
my research. Needless to say...
I cannot possibly thank you enough!<sp:0:4:0><snd:TalkPositive_01>Ahem. Speaking of thanks, Queen Yona
has been searching for the <clr:0000>Zora greaves<clr:ffff>.
She means to gift them to you.
I recall an ancient text mentioning that
they were dedicated at the <clr:0000>Ancient Zora
Waterworks<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>However,<sp:5:1:0> Queen Yona has searched the
waterworks and turned up nothing. The
greaves are nowhere to be found.
Despite that, I still feel as if they must be
somewhere within the waterworks...

Perhaps they are in a less obvious place.
Or maybe...there is a chamber in the
waterworks we are unaware of?
talk1055:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_01>Ah, Link! It is good to see you. I am, after
all, indebted to you for your repair of the
stone slate.
Thanks to your efforts, the sludge has
disappeared, meaning that I can resume
my research.
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive>All of the stone monuments across the
various Zora regions, including this one,
were made anew.
They were all thoughtfully written by our
beloved Prince Sidon... Oh! I meant to
say our beloved KING Sidon.
If you ever see one during your travels,
I encourage you to read it.

talk1056:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy>You have a gift, Link! With your help,
research that would normally take a
century is achieved almost instantly!
Once the turmoil over these unfortunate
phenomena has subsided...<sp:5:0:0>I hope you will
consider joining me in my work!

talk1049:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think>I have already shared this with Queen
Yona, but I will let you in on it as well.

That ancient text mentioned that the
<clr:0000>Zora greaves<clr:ffff> were dedicated at the
<clr:0000>Ancient Zora Waterworks<clr:ffff>.
Since Queen Yona searched the
waterworks and yet did not find the
greaves, then I do wonder.
<snd:QuestionNormal>Specifically, I wonder whether or not there
might be some hidden chamber within the
waterworks that we have not known of.
talk1051: <sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Greeting_00>Ah, Link! I am pleased to see you.
